back: The process of going from a high-dimensionality data set to a lower-dimensionality data set, while preserving as much important information as possible.

Suppose  $\mathbf{X}$ has non-singular covariance matrix $\mathbf{K}_X$, with eigendecomposition $\mathbf{K}_X = \mathbf{U} \boldsymbol{\Lambda}\mathbf{U}^T$. Then $\mathbf{Y} = \mathbf{U}^T \mathbf{X}$ consists of uncorrelated random variables and $\mathbf{K}_Y = \boldsymbol{\Lambda}.$
Given a multi-dimensional data set, PCA is the process by which the data is decorrelated using the modal matrix of the sample covariance matrix.
